H0.text: Oxygen is the resultant waste product of photosynthesis.

H1.text: Carbon is the resultant waste product of photosynthesis.

H2.text: Argon is the resultant waste product of photosynthesis.

H3.text: Sulfur is the resultant waste product of photosynthesis.

A4.text: In nature, free oxygen is produced as a byproduct of light-driven splitting of water during chlorophyllic photosynthesis.

A5.text: Photosynthesis releases oxygen into the atmosphere, while respiration, decay, and combustion remove it from the atmosphere.
